div.sent: God, the Almighty We all know that God is the creator of everything.
He fosters and protect everything.
But sometimes a question comes in our mind: Where is God?
God is present every where.
He is in the Heaven and in the earth as well.
He is inside us and at the same time He is around us.
He exists in every man.
He can see everything at the same time.
He can see us even when we walk or sleep.
He also observes us when we do anything right or wrong.
He knows if we are kind.
He also knows if we are lazy.
We can't see God.
Because, He does not have any body, nor does he have any form.
He is only the soul.
Neither can we see nor we touch the soul.
For example, there is air everywhere around us.
Can we see or touch it?
No, we cannot.
We can only feel that there is air.
Similarly, we cannot see or touch God.
But we can only feel His existence.
God exists everywhere and He can see everything.
God is Almighty.
He has the power to do everything, see everything and know everything.
Only God can stay at different places at a time, because He is God.
Sometimes, we think God cannot see us, when we do anything in secret.
Suppose, we steal fruits from others trees and think no one has seen us.
But this is wrong.
We can take lesson from the Holy Bible.
There are many interesting stories in the Holy Bible.
They tell us that God can see everything and He knows everything.
From the story of Adam and Eve it can be clear to us.
Adam and Eve are the first human beings of His creation.
God created them according to His sweet will.
He let them live in the beautiful garden of the Eden.
There were all types of trees, flowers, fruits, animals and birds.
They all lived there quite happily in peace with Adam and Eve.
No one did any harm to other.
Adam and Eve got the duty from God to look after everything in the garden.
If you eat, you shall commit sin and shall be punished.
But they were tempted by Satan and disobeyed God.
Thus they committed sin.
They ate the fruits of the forbidden tree.
They thought God could not see them.
But God saw everything.
He called then on and asked Where are you?
Both Adam and Eve were afraid and hid themselves.
The God came to them.
Then they confessed to God that they had disobeyed Him.
O God, save me from all temptations.
I should not forget that You are always inside me, Amen.
